NLI utilities¶

class centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.arguments.DataTrainingArguments(task_name=None, dataset_name=None, dataset_config_name=None, max_seq_length=128, overwrite_cache=False, pad_to_max_length=True, max_train_samples=None, max_eval_samples=None, max_predict_samples=None, train_file=None, validation_file=None, test_file=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Arguments pertaining to the data for training and evaluation.

task_name¶

The name of the task to train on.

Type:

Optional[str]

dataset_name¶

The name of the dataset to use (via the datasets library).

Type:

Optional[str]

dataset_config_name¶

The configuration name of the dataset to use.

Type:

Optional[str]

max_seq_length¶

The maximum total input sequence length after tokenization.

Type:

int

overwrite_cache¶

Overwrite the cached preprocessed datasets or not.

Type:

bool

pad_to_max_length¶

Whether to pad all samples to ‘max_seq_length’.

Type:

bool

max_train_samples¶

Truncate the number of training examples for debugging or quicker training.

Type:

Optional[int]

max_eval_samples¶

Truncate the number of evaluation examples for debugging or quicker evaluation.

Type:

Optional[int]

max_predict_samples¶

Truncate the number of prediction examples for debugging or quicker prediction.

Type:

Optional[int]

train_file¶

Path to a CSV or JSON file containing the training data.

Type:

Optional[str]

validation_file¶

Path to a CSV or JSON file containing the validation data.

Type:

Optional[str]

test_file¶

Path to a CSV or JSON file containing the test data.

Type:

Optional[str]

Usage Example:
>>> from nli_utils.arguments import DataTrainingArguments
>>> data_args = DataTrainingArguments(
...     task_name="mnli",
...     max_seq_length=128,
...     train_file="path/to/train.csv",
...     validation_file="path/to/validation.csv"
... )
dataset_config_name: Optional[str] = None¶
dataset_name: Optional[str] = None¶
max_eval_samples: Optional[int] = None¶
max_predict_samples: Optional[int] = None¶
max_seq_length: int = 128¶
max_train_samples: Optional[int] = None¶
overwrite_cache: bool = False¶
pad_to_max_length: bool = True¶
task_name: Optional[str] = None¶
test_file: Optional[str] = None¶
train_file: Optional[str] = None¶
validation_file: Optional[str] = None¶
class centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.arguments.ModelArguments(model_name_or_path, config_name=None, tokenizer_name=None, cache_dir=None, use_fast_tokenizer=True, model_revision='main', token=None, trust_remote_code=False, ignore_mismatched_sizes=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Arguments pertaining to the model configuration.

model_name_or_path¶

Path to pretrained model or model identifier from huggingface.co/models.

Type:

str

config_name¶

Pretrained config name or path if not the same as model_name.

Type:

Optional[str]

tokenizer_name¶

Pretrained tokenizer name or path if not the same as model_name.

Type:

Optional[str]

cache_dir¶

Directory to store the pretrained models downloaded from huggingface.co.

Type:

Optional[str]

use_fast_tokenizer¶

Whether to use a fast tokenizer (backed by the tokenizers library) or not.

Type:

bool

model_revision¶

The specific model version to use (can be a branch name, tag name, or commit id).

Type:

str

token¶

The token for HTTP bearer authorization for remote files.

Type:

Optional[str]

trust_remote_code¶

Whether to allow custom models defined on the Hub in their own modeling files.

Type:

bool

ignore_mismatched_sizes¶

Enable loading a pretrained model whose head dimensions are different.

Type:

bool

Usage Example:
>>> from nli_utils.arguments import ModelArguments
>>> model_args = ModelArguments(
...     model_name_or_path="bert-base-uncased",
...     cache_dir="./cache",
... )
cache_dir: Optional[str] = None¶
config_name: Optional[str] = None¶
ignore_mismatched_sizes: bool = False¶
model_name_or_path: str¶
model_revision: str = 'main'¶
token: Optional[str] = None¶
tokenizer_name: Optional[str] = None¶
trust_remote_code: bool = False¶
use_fast_tokenizer: bool = True¶
centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.data.prepare_datasets(data_args, model_args)[source]¶

Load datasets based on the provided arguments.

Parameters:

  • data_args (DataTrainingArguments) – Data-related arguments.

  • model_args (ModelArguments) – Model-related arguments.

Returns:

Loaded datasets.

Return type:

datasets.DatasetDict

Usage Example:
>>> from nli_finetune.arguments import DataTrainingArguments, ModelArguments
>>> from nli_finetune.data import prepare_datasets
>>> data_args = DataTrainingArguments(task_name="mnli")
>>> model_args = ModelArguments(model_name_or_path="bert-base-uncased")
>>> datasets = prepare_datasets(data_args, model_args)
centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.data.preprocess_datasets(raw_datasets, data_args, tokenizer)[source]¶

Tokenize and preprocess the datasets.

Parameters:

  • raw_datasets (datasets.DatasetDict) – The raw datasets.

  • data_args (DataTrainingArguments) – Data-related arguments.

  • tokenizer (PreTrainedTokenizer) – The tokenizer.

Returns:

Tokenized and preprocessed datasets.

Return type:

datasets.DatasetDict

Usage Example:
>>> from transformers import AutoTokenizer
>>> tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("bert-base-uncased")
>>> tokenized_datasets = preprocess_datasets(raw_datasets, data_args, tokenizer)
centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.metrics.get_compute_metrics(is_regression, task_name=None)[source]¶

Returns a metrics computation function based on the task.

Parameters:

  • is_regression (bool) – Whether the task is a regression task.

  • task_name (Optional[str]) – The name of the GLUE task.

Returns:

A function that computes metrics.

Return type:

Callable[[EvalPrediction], dict]

Usage Example:
>>> from transformers import EvalPrediction
>>> compute_metrics = get_compute_metrics(is_regression=False, task_name="mnli")
>>> preds = np.array([[0.1, 0.9], [0.8, 0.2]])
>>> labels = np.array([1, 0])
>>> eval_pred = EvalPrediction(predictions=preds, label_ids=labels)
>>> metrics = compute_metrics(eval_pred)
centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.nli_trainer.evaluate(trainer, data_args, model_args, task_name=None)[source]¶

Evaluate the model using the Trainer.

Parameters:

  • trainer (Trainer) – The Trainer instance.

  • data_args (DataTrainingArguments) – Data-related arguments.

  • model_args (ModelArguments) – Model-related arguments.

  • task_name (Optional[str]) – The name of the task for evaluation.

Return type:

None

Usage Example:
>>> evaluate(trainer, data_args, model_args, task_name="mnli")
centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.nli_trainer.initialize_trainer(model, training_args, train_dataset, eval_dataset, tokenizer, data_collator, compute_metrics)[source]¶

Initialize the Hugging Face Trainer.

Parameters:

  • model (AutoModelForSequenceClassification) – The model to train.

  • training_args (TrainingArguments) – Training-related arguments.

  • train_dataset – The training dataset.

  • eval_dataset – The evaluation dataset.

  • tokenizer (PreTrainedTokenizer) – The tokenizer.

  • data_collator – Data collator for the trainer.

  • compute_metrics – Function to compute metrics.

Returns:

An initialized Trainer instance.

Return type:

Trainer

Usage Example:
>>> trainer = initialize_trainer(model, training_args, train_dataset, eval_dataset, tokenizer, data_collator, compute_metrics)
centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.nli_trainer.predict(trainer, data_args, model_args, task_name=None)[source]¶

Run predictions using the Trainer.

Parameters:

  • trainer (Trainer) – The Trainer instance.

  • data_args (DataTrainingArguments) – Data-related arguments.

  • model_args (ModelArguments) – Model-related arguments.

  • task_name (Optional[str]) – The name of the task for prediction.

Return type:

None

Usage Example:
>>> predict(trainer, data_args, model_args, task_name="mnli")
centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.nli_trainer.setup_logging(training_args)[source]¶

Configure logging for the training process.

Parameters:

training_args (TrainingArguments) – Training-related arguments.

Usage Example:
>>> setup_logging(training_args)
centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.nli_trainer.train(trainer, data_args, model_args)[source]¶

Train the model using the Trainer.

Parameters:

  • trainer (Trainer) – The Trainer instance.

  • data_args (DataTrainingArguments) – Data-related arguments.

  • model_args (ModelArguments) – Model-related arguments.

Return type:

None

Usage Example:
>>> train(trainer, data_args, model_args)
centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.run_glue.main()[source]¶
centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils.run_glue.run_glue(model_args, data_args, training_args)[source]¶

Executes the GLUE task by orchestrating data preparation, model training, evaluation, and prediction.

Parameters:

  • model_args (ModelArguments) – Configuration related to the model.

  • data_args (DataTrainingArguments) – Configuration related to data processing.

  • training_args (TrainingArguments) – Configuration related to training.

Return type:

None

Usage Example:
>>> from centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils import run_glue
>>> from centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils import DataTrainingArguments
>>> from centralized_nlp_package.nli_utils import ModelArguments
>>> from transformers import TrainingArguments
>>>
>>> model_args = ModelArguments(
...     model_name_or_path="bert-base-uncased",
...     cache_dir="./cache",
... )
>>> data_args = DataTrainingArguments(
...     task_name="mnli",
...     train_file="path/to/train.csv",
...     validation_file="path/to/validation.csv",
... )
>>> training_args = TrainingArguments(
...     output_dir="./output",
...     do_train=True,
...     do_eval=True,
...     num_train_epochs=3,
...     learning_rate=2e-5,
...     weight_decay=0.01,
...     per_device_train_batch_size=16,
...     per_device_eval_batch_size=16,
...     report_to="none",
... )
>>> run_glue(model_args, data_args, training_args)
